factText: PODS continues to keep a watchful eye on the #Saddleridge wildfire in northern Los Angeles County. On Saturday, the Saddleridge fire in Los Angeles County was 19% contained. Officials have started reopening freeways after the Saddleridge Fire exploded in the San Fernando Valley on Thursday evening. The LAPD is escorting Saddleridge Fire evacuees home briefly to retrieve vital items from three designated locations, but they are warning residents to be patient as they wait their turns.

factText: UPDATE (8 a.m. Saturday): The Saddleridge Fire is now 19 percent contained, according to Los Angeles Fire officials. As of 1 PM today, the Saddle Ridge Fire is 13% contained. BREAKING: With weakening winds, crews have increased containment of the Saddleridge Fire from 13 to 19% overnight. The size of the fire remained at 7,500 acres.
